00048       handle<cl_mem> createMemory(cl_mem_flags flags, unsigned int size, void * ptr = NULL)
00049       {
00050         if (ptr) flags |= CL_MEM_COPY_HOST_PTR;
00051         cl_int err;
00052         handle<cl_mem> mem = clCreateBuffer(_context, flags, size, ptr, &err);
00053         //assert(err == CL_SUCCESS);
00054         CL_ERR_CHECK(err);
00055         return mem;
00056       }
00057 
00058       template < typename SCALARTYPE, typename A, template <typename, typename> class VectorType >
00059       handle<cl_mem> createMemory(cl_mem_flags flags, const VectorType<SCALARTYPE, A> & _buffer)
00060       {
00061         return createMemory(flags, static_cast<unsigned int>(sizeof(SCALARTYPE) * _buffer.size()), (void*)&_buffer[0]);
00062       }

00130 
00131       Device()
00132       {
00133         cl_int err;
00134         char buffer[1024];
00135 
00136         err = clGetPlatformIDs(1, &platform, NULL);
00137         CL_ERR_CHECK(err);
00138         
00139         // Try to find a suitable GPU
00140         err = clGetDeviceIDs(platform, CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU, 1, &device, NULL);
00141         if (err == CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND)
00142         {
00143           //No suitable GPU found. Try to find a suitable CPU (available via ATI Stream SDK)
00144           err = clGetDeviceIDs(platform, CL_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU, 1, &device, NULL);
00145           
00146           //set default parameters:
00147           _type = CL_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU;
00148           _work_items_per_group = 1;
00149           _work_groups = 2;   //some experiments on a Core 2 Quad 9550 show that two work groups give good results
00150         }
00151         else
00152         {
00153           _type = CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU;
00154           _work_items_per_group = 128;
00155           _work_groups = 128;
00156         }
00157         CL_ERR_CHECK(err);
00158         
00159         //create OpenCL context for device
00160         _context = clCreateContext(0, 1, &device, NULL, NULL, &err);
00161         CL_ERR_CHECK(err);
00162         default_command_queue = clCreateCommandQueue(_context, device, 0, &err);
00163         CL_ERR_CHECK(err);
00164 
00165         //get extensions and search for double precision
00166         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS, sizeof(char)*1024, buffer, NULL);
00167         std::string extensions(buffer);
00168         supported_double = false;
00169         if (extensions.find("cl_khr_fp64") != std::string::npos
00170         #ifdef VIENNACL_EXPERIMENTAL_DOUBLE_PRECISION_WITH_STREAM_SDK_ON_CPU
00171           || extensions.find("cl_amd_fp64") != std::string::npos
00172         #endif
00173         #ifdef VIENNACL_EXPERIMENTAL_DOUBLE_PRECISION_WITH_STREAM_SDK_ON_GPU
00174           || extensions.find("cl_amd_fp64") != std::string::npos
00175         #endif
00176           )
00177         {
00178           //std::cout << "Double precision supported" << std::endl;
00179           supported_double = true;
00180         }
00181         
00182         //query a little bit of info:
00183         err = clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE, sizeof(size_t), &_max_work_group_size, NULL);
00184         CL_ERR_CHECK(err);
00185         err = clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_COMPUTE_UNITS, sizeof(cl_uint), &_compute_units, NULL);
00186         CL_ERR_CHECK(err);
00187       }
